title-part.text: CAPACITORS, RECTIFIERS, DETECTORS, SWITCHING DEVICES OR LIGHT-SENSITIVE DEVICES, OF THE ELECTROLYTIC TYPE

reference.text: selection of specified materials as dielectric H01B3/00; capacitors with potential-jump or surface barrier H01L29/00

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Details of capacitors not covered by a single one of groups H01G4/00-H01G11/00
specially adapted for mounting on a chassis
specially adapted for mounting on a printed-circuit support

CPC-specific-text.text: for surface mounting, e.g. chip capacitors
Sealings, e.g. for lead-in wires; Covers
Fixing the capacitor in a housing

title-part.text: Protection against electric or thermal overload
Arrangements for preventing discharge from edges of electrodes

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the ceramic dielectric material
based on titanium oxides or titanates
based on zirconium oxides or zirconates
based on niobium or tungsteen, tantalum oxides or niobates, tantalates
containing also zirconium oxides or zirconates
containing a glassy phase, e.g. glass ceramic

title-part.text: of synthetic material, e.g. derivatives of cellulose
using combinations of dielectrics from more than one of groups H01G4/02 - H01G4/06

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the composition of the impregnant

title-part.text: electrically connecting two or more layers of a stacked or rolled capacitor

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the material of the terminals

title-part.text: leading through the housing, i.e. lead-through
the capacitive element surrounding the terminal
Tabs between the layers of a rolled electrode
the terminals embracing or surrounding the capacitive element, e.g. caps
the terminals being coated on the capacitive element
Means for correcting the capacitance value

CPC-specific-text.text: obtained by injection of metal in cavities formed in a ceramic body
capacitors without a potential-jump or surface barrier specially adapted for integrated circuits, details thereof, multistep manufacturing processes therefor H01L28/40

title-part.text: Multiple capacitors, i.e. structural combinations of fixed capacitors

CPC-specific-text.text: Single unit multiple capacitors, e.g. dual capacitor in one coil

title-part.text: Structural combinations of fixed capacitors with other electric elements, the structure mainly consisting of a capacitor, e.g. RC combinations
Capacitors in which the capacitance is varied by mechanical means, e.g. by turning a shaft
at least one of the electrodes being a displaceable liquid or powder
Means for correcting the capacitance characteristics

CPC-specific-text.text: having air, gas, or vacuum as the dielectric

title-part.text: using variation of effective area of electrode
due to rotation of flat or substantially flat electrodes
due to rotation of helical electrodes
due to rotation of part-cylindrical, conical, or spherical electrodes
due to longitudinal movement of electrodes
using variation of distance between electrodes
due to change in inclination, e.g. by flexing, by spiral wrapping
Structural combinations of variable capacitors with other electric elements not covered by this subclass, the structure mainly consisting of a capacitor, e.g. RC combinations
Capacitors in which the capacitance is varied by non-mechanical means
Electrets, i.e. having a permanently-polarised dielectric
having a dielectric selected for the variation of its permittivity with applied temperature
having a dielectric selected for the variation of its permittivity with applied voltage, i.e. ferroelectric capacitors
Electrolytic capacitors, rectifiers, detectors, switching devices, light-sensitive or temperature-sensitive devices

CPC-specific-text.text: Protection against electric or thermal overload; cooling arrangements; means for avoiding the formation of cathode films
Formation of the solid electrolyte layer
Electrolytes specially adapted for double-layer capacitors

note.note-paragraph:
Group H01G9/038 is no longer used for the classification of documents as of 2021-01-01.
The content of this group is being reclassified into groups H01G11/54 - H01G11/64. Groups H01G9/038 and H01G11/54 - H01G11/64 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: or formation of dielectric layers thereon
consisting of tantalum, niobium, or sintered material; Combinations of such electrodes with solid semiconductive electrolytes, e.g. manganese dioxide

title-part.text: Vents or other means allowing expansion
for modifying, or compensating for, electric characteristics of electrolytic capacitors

note.note-paragraph: Group H01G9/155 is no longer used for the classification of documents as of 2021-01-01. The content of this group is being reclassified into groups H01G11/00 - H01G11/86. All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: specially for use as rectifiers or detectors

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the electrolyte, e.g. comprising an organic electrolyte
the electrolyte comprising ionic liquids, e.g. alkyl imidazolium iodide
characterised by the ionic charge transport species, e.g. redox shuttles
comprising mixed oxides, e.g. ZnO covered TiO2 particles
comprising a semiconductor electrode comprising elements of the fourth group of the Periodic System (C, Si, Ge, Sn, Pb) with or without impurities, e.g. doping materials
comprising a semiconductor electrode comprising AIII-BV compounds with or without impurities, e.g. doping materials
comprising a semiconductor electrode comprising AII-BVI compounds, e.g. CdTe, CdSe, ZnTe, ZnSe, with or without impurities, e.g. doping materials
comprising an organic dye as the active light absorbing material, e.g. adsorbed on an electrode or dissolved in solution
comprising a mixture of two or more dyes
Panels or arrays of photoelectrochemical cells, e.g. photovoltaic modules based on photoelectrochemical cells
comprising two or more photoelectrodes sensible to different parts of the solar spectrum, e.g. tandem cells
Sealing arrangements, e.g. to prevent the leakage of the electrolyte
Photoelectrochemical cells in the form of a fiber

title-part.text: Devices using combined reduction and oxidation, e.g. redox arrangement or solion
Structural combinations of electrolytic capacitors, rectifiers, detectors, switching devices, light-sensitive or temperature-sensitive devices with each other
Structural combinations of electrolytic capacitors, rectifiers, detectors, switching devices with other electric components not covered by this subclass
Hybrid capacitors, i.e. capacitors having different positive and negative electrodes
Processes specially adapted for the manufacture thereof or of parts thereof

note.note-paragraph: Group H01G11/02 takes precedence over groups H01G11/04 - H01G11/14

Group H01G11/00 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group H01G9/155.
Groups H01G9/155 and H01G11/00 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: using combined reduction-oxidation reactions, e.g. redox arrangement or solion
